title: Network Engineer
content:
Who we are 
About Stripe
Stripe is a financial infrastructure platform for businesses. Millions of companies - from the world’s largest enterprises to the most ambitious startups - use Stripe to accept payments, grow their revenue, and accelerate new business opportunities. Our mission is to increase the GDP of the internet, and we have a staggering amount of work ahead. That means you have an unprecedented opportunity to put the global economy within everyone's reach while doing the most important work of your career.
About the team
Stripe’s infrastructure powers businesses all over the world. We process payments, run marketplaces, help entrepreneurs start an internet business from anywhere in the world, and more. Infrastructure engineers at Stripe build the systems that power all of our products, globally and at scale.
Our users trust us with their businesses and livelihoods, and every request that Stripe handles is critical. We process billions of dollars every year for millions of users, from the largest enterprises to a startup making their first sale. We invest deeply in the reliability and security of our infrastructure to earn their trust.
We build the platform and infrastructure that sit at the intersection between our secure cardholder environment and the rest of Stripe. You’ll join the team that manages the physical network infrastructure which connects Stripe to our financial and cloud partners.
Our work provides a highly available, secure, and reliable network for Stripe to quickly build and deploy partner integrations that scale with our business and customers. We manage relationships with our data center partners to ensure the smooth operations of our networks and equipment. Every transaction through Stripes platform flows through our network, and we are committed to reliably delivering each packet to our financial partners.
We’re looking for people with a strong background in network engineering, software automation, and datacenter operations.
What you’ll do
Responsibilities
Design, build and operate Stripe's global physical data center network infrastructure
Design and manage network infrastructure for Stripe's cloud partners
Write software automation and tooling for Stripe's network infrastructure
Plan the future growth of our physical data centers and colocations
Collaborate with financial partners to drive connectivity and peering agreements
Visit Stripe data centers to perform maintenance and operations
Who you are
We're looking for someone who meets the minimum requirements to be considered for the role. If you meet these requirements, you are encouraged to apply. The preferred qualifications are a bonus, not a requirement.
Minimum requirements
A strong background (3+ years of industry experience) in network engineering and physical network technologies
Experience with managing physical network hardware and operating inside a data center or colocation environment
Experience automating network devices with tools or languages such as Ansible, Python, or Go
Experience with network protocols such as BGP, TCP, IPSEC, SNMP, VRRP
Preferred qualifications
Experience working within PCI data center environments
Experience managing and operating HSM hardware
Experience managing Linux based server infrastructure
Experience working with networking in cloud environments

questions.description: Stripe is currently operating in a hybrid work environment. In-office expectations for office-assigned Stripes vary by team. A remote location, in most cases, is defined as living 50 miles or more from an office location. While you would be welcome to join the office for team or business meetings when necessary, the expectation would be that you would regularly work from home rather than a Stripe office location. Stripe offices are located in Amsterdam, Bangkok, Bengaluru, Berlin, Chicago, Dubai, Dublin, Jakarta, London, Madrid, Mexico City, New York City, Paris, São Paulo, Singapore, South San Francisco, Seattle, Tokyo, and Toronto. Stripe does not cover the cost of relocating to a remote location. We encourage you to apply for roles that match the location in which you live or have intentions to live.
